text: Albert Mkrtchyan (, February 27, 1937, Leninakan – February 28, 2018, YerevanRenowned Armenian filmmaker Albert Mkrtchyan dies at 81); Armenian film director, screenwriter, actor. People's Artist of the Republic of Armenia (2003).Альберт Мкртчян He was the younger brother of Soviet actor Frunzik Mkrtchyan. ==Biography== Albert Mkrtchyan was born in 1937 in Leninakan. In 1960 Albert Mkrtchyan graduated from the Yerevan Fine Arts and Theatre Institute, in 1971 – from Gerasimov Institute of Cinematography, Moscow. From 1960 to 1966, he served as the director of the Armenian TV studio, since 1971 he had been the director of Hayfilm studio, 1995–1999 he was the director of Gyumri Drama Theater, since 2000 Mkrtchyan had been the director and artistic director of Mher Mkrtchyan Artistic Theater. Mkrtchyan had been a lecturer at the Armenian State Pedagogical University after Khachatur Abovyan and Yerevan State Institute of Theater and Cinema. ==Films== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !
